titleInfo.title: JOHNSON v. COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER THAT THE PETIITON FOR HABEAS CORPUS RELIEF IS DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO PETITIONER'S FILING A NEW PETITION; PETITIONER'S APPLICATION TO PROCEED IN FORMA PAUPERIS IS DENIED; THE CLERK OF COURT SHALL FURNISH PETITIONER WITH A BLANK COPY OF THIS COURT'S CURRENT STANDARD FORM FOR FILING A PTITION PURSUANT TO 28 U.S.C. SECTION 2254; IF PETITIONER DECIDES TO FILE A NEW PETITION HE SHALL FULLY COMPLETE THIS COURT'S CURRENT STANDARD FORM OF PETITION AS DIRECTED BY LOCAL CIVIL RULE 9.3(b) AND RULE 2 OF THE RULES GOVERNING SECTION 2254 CASES IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURTS, SIGN THE COMPLETED PETITION AND RETURN IT TO THE CLERK OF COURTS; AND IF A NEW PETITION IS FILED, IT SHALL BE OPENED AS A NEW CIVIL MATTER.. SIGNED BY HONORABLE EDMUND V. LUDWIG ON 1/26/09. 1/28/09 ENTERED AND COPIES MAILED, E-MAILED AND FAXED.(lvj, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:08-cv-06055; JOHNSON v. COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA et al;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of Pennsylvania
extension.docketText: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER THAT THE PETIITON FOR HABEAS CORPUS RELIEF IS DISMISSED WITHOUT PREJUDICE TO PETITIONER'S FILING A NEW PETITION; PETITIONER'S APPLICATION TO PROCEED IN FORMA PAUPERIS IS DENIED; THE CLERK OF COURT SHALL FURNISH PETITIONER WITH A BLANK COPY OF THIS COURT'S CURRENT STANDARD FORM FOR FILING A PTITION PURSUANT TO 28 U.S.C. SECTION 2254; IF PETITIONER DECIDES TO FILE A NEW PETITION HE SHALL FULLY COMPLETE THIS COURT'S CURRENT STANDARD FORM OF PETITION AS DIRECTED BY LOCAL CIVIL RULE 9.3(b) AND RULE 2 OF THE RULES GOVERNING SECTION 2254 CASES IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURTS, SIGN THE COMPLETED PETITION AND RETURN IT TO THE CLERK OF COURTS; AND IF A NEW PETITION IS FILED, IT SHALL BE OPENED AS A NEW CIVIL MATTER.. SIGNED BY HONORABLE EDMUND V. LUDWIG ON 1/26/09. 1/28/09 ENTERED AND COPIES MAILED, E-MAILED AND FAXED.(lvj, )
